DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether low doses of prednisolone, or colchicine are effective in the treatment of oral aphthae.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Therapeutic Effect of 0.5 mg Colchicine and 5 mg Prednisolone on Oral Aphthae
DOC.detailed_description: Treatment of recurrent aphthous stomatitis (RAS) remains, to date, empirical and non-specific. The main goals of therapy are to minimize pain and functional disabilities as well as decrease inflammatory reactions and frequency of recurrences.
DOC.criteria: Confirmation of clinical diagnosis of aphthae Having the experience of oral aphthae at least once in a month Two weeks wash out periods after the last treatment History of any systemic disease Using drugs which affect immune system Pregnancy and breast feeding Aphthous related syndromes
